description.narrative: The purpose of the Emergency COVID-19 Project in Georgia is to prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 (Coronavirus) and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness. This project consists of three components. Component one is Emergency COVID-19 (Coronavirus) Response. There are two subcomponents; (i) Case Detection and Confirmation, and; (ii) Health System Strengthening for Case Management. The second component will enable health measures to contain the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak through temporary Income support for poor households and vulnerable Individuals. There are two subcomponents: (i) Cash transfers to poor and vulnerable households, and; (ii) Temporary unemployment assistance for individuals who lose their job because of the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak. Component three will support project implementation for the overall administration of the project.

condition.narrative: The Borrower shall ensure that the Project is implemented in accordance with the Environmental and Social Commitment Plan (“ESCP”),in a manner acceptable to the Bank.

The Borrower shall no later than one hundred and fifty (150) days after the Signature Date, adopt the Plan of Action, after takinginto account recommendations of the Bank, and thereafter begin to implement the Plan of Action in accordance with its terms, in amanner satisfactory to the Bank.

The Borrower shall no later than one hundred and thirty (130) days days after the Signature Date, provide the Bank a proposed plan(“Plan of Action”) setting out the timeline and steps for carrying out the recommendations set out in the 2018 and 2019 a reportsfrom the State Audit Office of Georgia.

The Borrower, shall prepare and adopt no later than one hundred and thirty (130) after the Signature Date, a Project operationsmanual (“Project Operations Manual”) containing: detailed guidelines and procedures for the implementation of the Project.

The Borrower, through MoILHSA and the Ministry of Finance, shall prepare and adopt no later than one hundred and fifty (150) daysafter the Signature Date the “Global Budget and Reimbursements Manual”.

The Borrower, through MoILHSA, shall: (a) establish no later than thirty (30) days after the Signature Date, and thereaftermaintain throughout the implementation of the Project, a Project Implementation Unit (“PIU”) with composition, resources, and termsof reference acceptable to the Bank; and (b) vest responsibility for day-to-day implementation of the Project to such PIU.

title.narrative: Complaints received related to COVID-related social assistance programs.
Percentage of beneficiaries reporting that community engagement and outreach meet their needs.
Number of vulnerable households receiving temporary cash benefit.
Number of formal private sector workers laid off because of COVID-related lock down who receive temporary unemployment benefits, by gender.
Number of designated laboratories with COVID-19 diagnostic equipment, test kits, and reagents per MOILHSA guidelines.
Number of informal workers who receive the one-off benefit , by gender
Number of personal protection equipment (PPE) purchased.
Number of designated public hospitals with isolation capacity.
Share of the population in the poorest quintile who are receiving the COVID-19 pandemic related social assistance programs.
Number of COVID-19 patients treated per SSA reimbursement guidelines.
Number of people tested for COVID-19 identification per MoILHSA protocol
Number of designated public hospitals with fully equipped and functional intensive care units (ICUs) for COVID-19 patients
